member.name: T:PRISM.Logging.ILogger
member.summary: Defines the logging interface.

member.name: M:PRISM.Logging.ILoggerAware.RegisterExceptionLogger(PRISM.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Register an ILogger with a class to have it log any exception that might occur.
member.param: A logger object to be used when logging is desired.

member.name: M:PRISM.Logging.ILoggerAware.RegisterEventLogger(PRISM.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Register an ILogger with a class to have it log any event that might occur.
member.param: A logger object to be used when logging is desired.

member.name: P:PRISM.Logging.ILoggerAware.NotifyOnEvent
member.summary: Set true and the class will raise events. Set false and it will not.
member.remarks: A function like the one shown below can be placed in ILoggerAware class that will only raise the event in the event of one needing to be raised.

member.name: P:PRISM.Logging.ILoggerAware.NotifyOnException
member.summary: Set true and the class will throw exceptions. Set false and it will not
member.remarks: A function like this can be place in ILoggerAware class that will only throw an exception in the event of one needing to be thrown.

member.name: T:PRISM.Logging.ILoggerAware
member.summary: Defines the logging aware interface.
member.remarks: This interface is used by any class that wants to optionally support logging to a logger that implements the ILogger interface. The key here is the phrase optionally. The class allows, but does not require the class user to supply an ILogger. If the Logger is not specified, the class throw Exceptions and raises Events in the usual way. If an ILogger is specified, the user has the option of just logging, or logging and throwing/raising Exceptions/Events in the usual way as well.

member.summary: Start the log output thread if it isn't already running.

member.summary: Pull all entries from the queue and output them to the log streams.

member.summary: Writes a message to the log.

member.summary: Posts a message to the log.
member.param: The exception associated with the error.

member.name: T:PRISM.Logging.clsQueLogger
member.summary: Wraps a queuing mechanism around any object that implements ILogger interface.
member.remarks: The posting member functions of this class put the log entry onto the end of an internal queue and return very quickly to the caller. A separate thread within the class is used to perform the actual output of the log entries using the logging object that is specified in the constructor for this class.

member.summary: Interface used for logging exceptions.

member.summary: Interface used for logging errors and health related messages.

member.summary: True for logging behavior, else false.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_NotifyOnEvent
member.summary: True for logging behavior, else false.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_Process
member.summary: Used to start and monitor the external program.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_pid
member.summary: The process id of the currently running incarnation of the external program.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_Thread
member.summary: The internal thread used to run the monitoring code.
member.remarks: That starts and monitors the external program

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_doCleanup
member.summary: Flag that tells internal thread to quit monitoring external program and exit.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_monitorInterval
member.summary: The interval for monitoring thread to wake up and check m_doCleanup.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_ExitCode
member.summary: Exit code returned by completed process.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_name
member.summary: Parameters for external program.

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_CachedConsoleOutput
member.summary: Caches the text written to the Console by the external program

member.name: F:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.m_CachedConsoleError
member.summary: Caches the text written to the Error buffer by the external program

member.name: E:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.ProgChanged
member.summary: This event is raised whenever the state property changes.

member.name: E:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.ConsoleOutputEvent
member.summary: This event is raised when the external program writes text to the console

member.name: E:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.ConsoleErrorEvent
member.summary: This event is raised when the external program writes text to the console's error stream

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.Arguments
member.summary: Arguments supplied to external program when it is run.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.CachedConsoleOutput
member.summary: Text written to the Console by the external program (including carriage returns)

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.CachedConsoleError
member.summary: Any text written to the Error buffer by the external program

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.CacheStandardOutput
member.summary: When true then will cache the text the external program writes to the console Can retrieve using the CachedConsoleOutput readonly property Will also fire event ConsoleOutputEvent as new text is written to the console
member.remarks: If this is true, then no window will be shown, even if CreateNoWindow=False

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.ConsoleOutputFilePath
member.summary: File path to which the console output will be written if WriteConsoleOutputToFile is true If blank, then file path will be auto-defined in the WorkDir when program execution starts

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.CreateNoWindow
member.summary: Determine if window should be displayed. Will be forced to True if CacheStandardOutput = True

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.EchoOutputToConsole
member.summary: When true, then echoes, in real time, text written to the Console by the external program Ignored if CreateNoWindow = False

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.ExitCode
member.summary: Exit code when process completes.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.MonitoringInterval
member.summary: How often (milliseconds) internal monitoring thread checks status of external program Minimum allowed value is 50 milliseconds

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.Name
member.summary: Name of this progrunner.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.NotifyOnEvent
member.summary: Gets or Sets notify on event.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.NotifyOnException
member.summary: Gets or Sets notify on exception.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.PID
member.summary: Process id of currently running external program's process.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.Program
member.summary: External program that prog runner will run. This is the full path to the program file

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.Repeat
member.summary: Whether prog runner will restart external program after it exits.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.RepeatHoldOffTime
member.summary: Time (seconds) that prog runner waits to restart external program after it exits.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.State
member.summary: Current state of prog runner (as number).

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.StateName
member.summary: Current state of prog runner (as descriptive name).

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.WindowStyle
member.summary: Window style to use when CreateNoWindow is False.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.WorkDir
member.summary: Working directory for process execution. Not necessarily the same as the directory that contains the program we're running.

member.name: P:PRISM.Processes.clsProgRunner.WriteConsoleOutputToFile
member.summary: When true then will write the standard output to a file in real-time Will also fire event ConsoleOutputEvent as new text is written to the console Define the path to the file using property ConsoleOutputFilePath; if not defined, the file will be created in the WorkDir
member.remarks: If this is true, then no window will be shown, even if CreateNoWindow=False

member.summary: This version of the constructor requires you to specify the sharename by setting the Share property.

member.summary: This version of the constructor allows you to specify the sharename as an argument.

member.summary: This routine is called by each of the constructors to make the actual assignments in a consistent fashion.

member.name: P:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.Share
member.summary: Sets the name of the file share to which you will connect.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to specified share using account/password specified through the constructor and the file share name passed as an argument.
member.param: The name of the file share to which you will connect.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.Connect
member.summary: Connects to specified share using account/password specified through the constructor. Requires you to have specifyed the sharename by setting the Share property.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.RealConnect
member.summary: Connects to specified share using account/password specified previously. This is the function that actually does the connection based on the setup from the Connect functions.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the files share.

member.name: P:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets the error message returned by the Connect and Disconnect functions.

member.name: T:PRISM.Files.ShareConnector
member.summary: Connects to a file share using a password and user name.
member.remarks: The default behaviour when connecting to SMB/CIFS file shares is for the system to supply the user name and password used to logon to the local machine. This class allows you to connect to SMB/CIFS file shares when the use of SSPI isn't availabe and/or when you don't wish to use the default behaviour. It's quite comparable to the "Connect using a different user name." option in the Map Network Drive utility in Windows. Much of this code came from Microsoft Knowledge Base Article - 173011. It was then modified to fit our needs.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.CheckTerminatorEX(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)

member.remarks: AddTerm=True forces the path to end with specified TermChar while AddTerm=False will remove TermChar from the end if present

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.CopyFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies a source file to the destination file. Does not allow overwriting.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.CopyFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies a source file to the destination file. Allows overwriting.
member.param: True if the destination file can be overwritten; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.CopyFileEx(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies a source file to the destination file. Allows overwriting.
member.remarks: This function is unique in that it allows you to specify a destination path where some of the directories do not already exist. It will create them if they don't. The last parameter specifies whether a file already present in the destination directory will be overwritten - Note: requires Imports System.IO - Usage: CopyFile("C:\Misc\Bob.txt", "D:\MiscBackup\Bob.txt")
member.param: True if the destination file can be overwritten; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.CopyFileUsingLocks(System.String,System.String,System.IO.FileInfo,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)

Path to the lock folder for the target file; can be an empty string

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.ValidateFreeDiskSpace(System.String,System.Double,System.String@)
member.summary: Confirms that the drive for the target output file has a minimum amount of free disk space
member.param: Path to output file; defines the drive or server share for which we will determine the disk space
Minimum free disk space, in MB. Will default to 150 MB if zero or negative
Output message if there is not enough free space (or if the path is invalid)
member.returns: True if more than minimumFreeSpaceMB is available; otherwise false

member.name: M:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools.ValidateFreeDiskSpace(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.String@)
member.summary: Confirms that the drive for the target output file has a minimum amount of free disk space
member.param: Path to output file; defines the drive or server share for which we will determine the disk space
Expected size of the output file
Minimum free disk space, in MB. Will default to 150 MB if zero or negative. Takes into account outputFileExpectedSizeMB
Output message if there is not enough free space (or if the path is invalid)
member.returns: True if more than minimumFreeSpaceMB is available; otherwise false

member.name: T:PRISM.Files.clsFileTools
member.summary: Tools to manipulate paths and directories.
member.remarks: There is a set of functions to properly terminate directory paths. There is a set of functions to copy an entire directory tree. There is a set of functions to copy an entire directory tree and resume copying interrupted files. There is a set of functions to get the size of an entire directory tree, including the number of files and directories.
